medical_history.chief_complaint: Caffeine hypersensitivity characterized by generalized urticaria.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Generalized urticaria developed after intake of Thomapyrin (250mg aspirin, 200mg paracetamol, 50mg caffeine) two months prior to presentation. The patient also reported generalized urticaria on six separate occasions after consuming coffee, requiring hospitalization once. Symptoms began following contact with caffeinated products, specifically after one cup of coffee, which occurred with varying latency, up to 20 minutes post-exposure to 150mg caffeine.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No prior history of atopy or adverse drug reactions. The patient has experienced hypersensitivity reactions linked to caffeine and related compounds.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a 69-year-old woman with no significant health issues mentioned apart from caffeine hypersensitivity and prior experiences with other analgesics.
